children.name: now
children.definition: at this moment or at this time:
examples: ▪ If we leave now we’ll be there before dark.
▪ It’s not raining now, but they said it might rain later.
▪ He used to coach high school basketball but now he’s a realtor.

children.name: from now onstarting from now
examples: ▪ Students are to be in their seats by 8:00 from now on.
▪ From now on, the U.S. government will rely on a new method to measure economic growth.

children.name: currently
children.definition: now - use this when you are describing what the situation is at this time:

children.name: hiện tại, hiện nay
examples: ▪ The firm currently employs 113 people.
▪ Currently, the most a senior nurse can earn is £16,000.
▪ Ms. Kelly is currently assisting another customer. May I help you?

children.name: at present
children.definition: /at the present time formalif something istrueat present or at the present time, it is true now but you donotexpectit to bepermanent:

children.name: hiện tại , hiện giờ
examples: ▪ The money available for public libraries will be less in future than at present.
▪ We do not envisage any changes in the tax structure at the present time.

children.name: right now
children.definition: at this moment or at this time:
examples: ▪ I need a new car but right now I can’t afford one.
▪ She’s in Amsterdam right now but she should be in Paris by tomorrow night.

children.name: just now
children.definition: Britishspokenat this exact moment - use this especially to say that youcannot do something immediately:
examples: ▪ Sorry, I’m busy just now - can I call you later?

children.name: at the moment
children.definition: /presently  now - use this especially to say that something is happening now but you donotexpectittocontinuefor a long time:

children.name: hiện tại, hiện giờ
examples: ▪ I’m working in a restaurant at the moment.
▪ Miss Hellman is away from her desk at the moment - can I have her call you back?
▪ The official currency is the crown, presently about 30 to the dollar.

children.name: at this time
children.definition: American at this particular time:
examples: ở thời điểm này
▪ I have no further questions at this time, your honor.
▪ ‘Do you have any health insurance?’ ‘Not at this time.’
at this time of day/night/year etc
▪ What are you doing out at this time of night?
▪ Gas prices always go up at this time of year.

children.name: now
children.definition: use this when you are comparing the present situation with what happened in the past:

children.name: bây giờ
examples: ▪ We used to be good friends but I don’t see very much of her now.
▪ Julie has moved to a new school and she’s much happier now.

children.name: nowadays
children.definition: /these days  use this when you aredescribinghow lifeisdifferentnow from the way it was in the past. These days is more common in spoken English:

children.name: ngày nay , thời nay
examples: ▪ It seems you’re not allowed to smoke anywhere nowadays.
▪ Children can’t play in the street these days - the traffic’s too bad.
▪ Nowadays, you hardly ever seen anyone wearing a tie to work.

children.name: today
children.definition: at the present time, especially whencomparedwith the past:

children.name: ngày nay , thời nay
examples: ▪ Today, only a few of these beautiful animals survive.
▪ Couples today are much more likely to marry in their 30s.
▪ The cost to install solar panels has dropped from $20 a watt in 1980 to as little as $5 today.

children.name: in this day and age
children.definition: use this to show that you are surprised and shocked that something still happens now:

children.name: trong thời đại ngày nay
examples: ▪ It’s not right, in this day and age, that people all over the world are still starving.
▪ It’s amazing that you can still find a house for under $100,000 in this day and age.

children.name: so far
children.definition: until now - use this when you are talking about a situation thatwill continue or developafter this time:
examples: ▪ There haven’t been any problems so far.
▪ This is the hottest day we’ve had so far this summer.
▪ We’ve raised twelve thousand dollars so far, and we expect to reach our goal by the end of next week.

children.name: still
children.definition: use this to say that a situation which started in the past continues to exist now, especially when this issurprising:

children.name: vẫn
examples: ▪ He’s been studying French for five years, and still can’t speak the language.
▪ Are you still going out with that guy you met at Heather’s party?

children.name: yet
children.definition: use this inquestionsornegativestatements, to talk or ask about things that you expected to happen before now:

children.name: chưa
examples: ▪ Has the new washing machine arrived yet?
▪ I haven’t been to the new exhibit yet, but I hope to this weekend.

children.name: up to now/until now
children.definition: use this about a situation which has existed until now, but which has started to change or will change in the future:

children.name: cho đến lúc này
examples: ▪ He hasn’t gotten much time off from work up to now, so he’s really looking forward to his vacation.
▪ Until now, there has been no effective treatment for this disease.

children.name: up to the present day
children.definition: /until the present day  from a time in the past until modern times:

children.name: cho đến ngày nay
examples: ▪ These two companies have dominated the industry from the end of World War II until the present day.
▪ The beauty of Yosemite has inspired artists from Bierstadt’s time right up to the present day.

children.name: happening now, but likely to change
for now
children.definition: /for the time being  for a short time, but not permanently - use this about atemporaryarrangementorwayof dealingwith a situation:

children.name: tạm thời, hiện tại
examples: ▪ Leave the groceries there for now - I’ll put them away later.
▪ For the time being he can stay here, but I want that dog out of here by the end of the week.

children.name: for the moment
children.definition: especiallyspokenuse this to say that something is true or happening now, but may change soon:

children.name: hiện tại
examples: ▪ For the moment the city seems quiet, but the fighting could start again at any time.

children.name: ▪ ‘How’s your apartment?’ ‘It’s fine for the moment, but I’d rather live nearer town.’
examples: ▪ Assuming for the moment that you did get the job, where would you live?

children.name: as of now
children.definition: American use this to say that something is true or happening now, but will probably change in the future:

children.name: hiện tại thì
examples: ▪ As of now, there is no cure for multiple sclerosis.
▪ My plan, as of now, is to graduate in May then start looking for a job in the fall.

children.name: hiện tại
examples: ▪ It is assumed, for the present, that the meeting will go ahead.
▪ A reduction in interest rates seems highly unlikely for the present.

children.name: in the meanwhile
children.definition: /in the meantime  between now and some time in the future, for example until a situation changes:

children.name: trong khi đó
examples: ▪ Payday is not until next week, but if you need any money in the meanwhile, let me know.
▪ You probably won’t receive the contract until Thursday but I can fax you a copy in the meantime.

children.name: meanwhile
examples: ▪ The flight will be announced soon. Meanwhile, please remain seated.

children.name: when st does not happen now
no longer
children.definition: use this to say that a situation that existed until recently does not exist now:

children.name: ko nữa
examples: ▪ He no longer felt sure that he was right.

children.name: + adj
examples: ▪ The bridge had collapsed, and it was no longer possible to cross the river.

children.name: not now
children.definition: use this to say that something happened in the past, but it does not happen now:

children.name: bây giờ thì không ( quá khứ thì có )
examples: ▪ When I was younger I spent hours lying out in the sun but not now.
▪ People used to respect teachers, but they don’t now.

children.name: not any more
children.definition: used when something has changed, especiallysuddenly:

children.name: ko ... nữa
examples: ▪ Alex doesn’t work here any more.
▪ Do what you like. I don’t care any more!
▪ At one time doctors recommended red meat as part of a healthy diet but not any more.

children.name: existing, happening, or relating to now
current
children.definition: use this about asituationoractivitywhich is happening now, but which isnotexpectedtocontinuefor a long time:
examples: hiện tại, hiện hành, hiện nay
▪ In the current economic situation, switching careers may not be such a good idea.
▪ Coca-Cola’s current advertising campaign
current level/rate/price
▪ The aim is to reduce current pollution levels in the Black Sea.
▪ According to one economist, at the current growth rate, China will have the largest economy in the world by 2030.

children.name: present
children.definition: the presentsituationis the one that exists now; your present job, address etc is the one that you have now:

children.name: hiện tại
examples: ▪ Arnaud lived in Los Angeles before moving to his present home in New York.
▪ He warned that the present situation could get much worse.

children.name: existing
children.definition: use this aboutthingsorsituationsthat exist now, when you think they may be changed in the future:

children.name: hiện tại
examples: ▪ The existing building is too small, and there are plans to replace it within the next five years.
▪ Many people feel that the existing law discriminates against women.

children.name: today’s/of today
children.definition: use this aboutsocial,economic, orpoliticalconditions and attitudes that exist now, when you arecomparingthem with those that existed in the past:

children.name: ngày nay, thời nay
examples: ▪ The first computers were extremely slow by today’s standards.
▪ The teenagers of today have a different attitude to sex.

children.name: modern-day/present-day
children.definition: a present-day situation, fact, idea etc is one that exists now rather than in the past:

children.name: thời nay, ngày nay
examples: ▪ Modern-day equipment has made mining much safer than it was.
▪ There is no modern-day racing driver who could be compared with Fangio.
▪ Prussia reached its zenith in 1795, encompassing most of northern Germany and present-day Poland.

children.name: modern
children.definition: belonging to the present time or most recent time and not to the past:

children.name: hiện đại
examples: ▪ I don’t like modern architecture at all.
▪ The pyramids are a remarkable piece of engineering, even judged by modern standards.
▪ The most compelling work in the modern British theater is being created in the smaller and non-profit theaters.

children.name: contemporary
children.definition: contemporary art, writing, thought, society etc is the type that exists, is accepted, or belongs to, the present time:

children.name: đương thời
examples: ▪ Contemporary Indian cinema has its roots in folk culture.

children.name: ▪ the declining importance of religion in contemporary societies
topical
children.definition: a story, subject, problem etc that is topical isinterestingbecause it deals with something that is important at the moment:

children.name: thời sự
examples: ▪ It’s an old story but it has a topical message.
▪ In the 1970s, he recorded topical songs about Watergate and the Vietnam War.
▪ The editor thinks that if an article isn’t topical it isn’t worth publishing.

children.name: latter-day
children.definition: someone who exists now and is a very similar type of person as someone who existed in the past:

children.name: thời hiện đại ( nhân vật trong quá khứ )
examples: ▪ Romer portrayed himself as a latter-day Robin Hood who took money and gave it to the underprivileged.
